title: Thunderbird Email: Inbox messages disappeared
content: All the messages in my Inbox disappeared this morning. I have a MacBook Air running Sonoma 14.7.2, my ISP is Gandi, and Thunderbird 115.4.1 is my email. I had clicked on a link in an email from a known source and when I returned to email, all the inbox messages were gone. All other folders (Sent, Drafts, etc) are there and current. My husband and I each have email accounts; his Inbox is all there too. The Inbox emails were not in the Trash, Deleted or Junk folders. I closed Thunderbird and reopened; messages still gone. I closed all apps, shut down the computer and restarted; opened Thunderbird, messages still gone. When I look at the Profile files, I can't tell which one would be my Inbox, but none of the likely candidates seems big enough to hold the, um, 7000+ messages that were there. I have spent the day internet-searching and reading various posts on disappearing messages - most of which are very old and/or for Windows - but I am unable to figure out what to do. Are the messages somewhere in the Profile? Are they on my ISP's server? How can I get them back into the Inbox? Thanks for any help.
creator: carla33

title: Can't send or receive e-mail from Earthlink
content:
Since January 8th, 2025 I have not been able to send or receive mail on a regular basis out of Thunderbird. the strange thing is sometimes I can start Thunderbird and it will maybe download current messages, but won't work the rest of the day. Even getting a once in awhile batch of e-mail, I can't send anything at anytime. I don not have a problem going to Earthlink.net/webmail and reading my mail there, but it is not always easy to do this.....thus Thunderbird!! 

Thunderbird is up to date.

server: pop.ix.netcom.com on port 110 connectin security as None 

Encrypted password checked.

My outgoing server is amtpauth.earthlink.net port 587 authentication method: Encrypted password connection Security None. 

All of this has not changed since mozilla made changes years ago and they are the same settings that are reccommended by Mozilla Thunderbird for the ix.netcom.com people.

I sure have to have to move to another progam, but I can't keep putting up with this. Hopefully someone can help!! I've added images of my settings and also of the error message I get when trying to send mail. BTW We had about 5 sessions with the India help desk at which we kept getting cut off. When finally getting to chat with someone....they had no answers, they said they would esculate the problem and someone would call in 24 hrs. That never happened...The case ID # 203683399 NO ONE EVER RESPONDED and so the problem persists.
creator: mercedes2000_12

title: Can't send emails

The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again. I am not aware that I have changed any settings. I can receive emails okay but have not been able to send them since 12 January 2025. Please help.

title: Since Jan13-2025 Thunderbird has not downloaded any emails
content:
Since January 13, 2025 Thunderbird has not downloaded any emails.

I set the TLS setting from 3 to 1 and closed and re-opened Thunderbird, but still no downloads. I am able to send messages. I have turned off anti-virus programs, but still no downloads.

When I click on the download button or select the File option to download messages, no information is displayed, and nothing happens.

I have check if there are new messages to download from Optus by logging in to Webmail. I have successfully emailed a message from Thunderbird.

I have contributed to Thunderbird development because it is the best, and I have used it since its first availability. Now I am without it.

Please inform me of how to fix the problem.
creator: raymondwk

title: Messaggi presenti in "Posta in arrivo" effettuando ricerca, ma non visibili scorrendo "Posta in arrivo"
content: Buongiorno a tutti, nella prima fase di scarico di tutti i messaggi gmail utilizzando il sistema POP3 avevo lasciato come cartella di destinazione predefinita quella proposta su PC, ma avevo poco spazio e siccome lo scarico si era fermato, pensavo fosse bloccato dalla mancanza di memoria. Ho quindi modificato le impostazioni di destinazione creando una cartella Posta su un server NAS. Risultato: ora ho scaricato tutte le 20mila mail, che sembra siano tutte presenti, sia ricevute sia spedite (anche se avevo capito che le spedite non le avrebbe scaricate), ma quelle degli anni 2007/2014 le trovo solo se faccio ricerca, mentre scorrendo la lista Posta in arrivo è come se non ci fossero. Come faccio a farle riapparire nell'elenco, in fondo, dato che ho ordinato per data decrescente di arrivo? Inoltre, c'è modo di separare nuovamente le spedite dalle ricevute? Ultima domanda: rischio qualcosa a cancellare "Tutte le email" dal sito gmail? ormai dovrei aver tutto al sicuro sul mio server. grazie
creator: stefano.vass
